ppe_requirements.respiratory: NIOSH-approved air-purifying respirator with P100 filters for ≤2.5 µg/m³. Powered air-purifying respirator (PAPR) for ≤12.5 µg/m³. SCBA for >12.5 µg/m³ or unknown concentrations.
ppe_requirements.skin: Nitrile or neoprene gloves (>4mil thickness). Chemical-resistant clothing. Cr(VI) can cause allergic skin reactions and ulcerations.
ppe_requirements.eye: Chemical safety goggles, face shield for dusty/spray operations
ppe_requirements.minimum_level: Level C for known concentrations <2.5 µg/m³, Level B for higher concentrations or welding/cutting operations
ppe_requirements.special_notes: CARCINOGEN and ALLERGEN. Prevent skin contact - causes sensitization. Welding/cutting stainless steel generates Cr(VI) fume. Use wet methods to control dust. Medical surveillance required.

physical_properties.appearance: Yellow to orange-red crystalline solid (chromates), green solution (chromic acid)

emergency_response.fire_hazard: Non-combustible. Strong oxidizer - increases fire intensity. Chromates may explode when heated with organic materials.
emergency_response.fire_suppression: Use agent appropriate for surrounding fire. Do not use water on dichromate fires. Wear SCBA.
emergency_response.spill_procedures: Evacuate area. Wear full PPE. Avoid dust generation. Reduce Cr(VI) to Cr(III) with sodium bisulfite or ferrous sulfate before cleanup. Sweep/vacuum with HEPA filter. Dispose as hazardous waste. Decontaminate area thoroughly.
emergency_response.exposure_immediate_actions: Remove contaminated clothing immediately. Wash skin with soap and water for 15 minutes. If inhaled, move to fresh air. Seek medical attention immediately - inform physician of Cr(VI) exposure and potential for delayed effects.
emergency_response.environmental_hazards: Toxic to aquatic life. Cr(VI) is highly mobile in groundwater. Can contaminate drinking water. Report releases >5000 lbs.
emergency_response.special_hazards: KNOWN HUMAN CARCINOGEN (IARC Group 1). Causes lung cancer, nasal septum perforation. Strong oxidizer - reacts violently with combustibles. Corrosive to skin (ulcers/chrome holes). Potent allergen - can cause severe dermatitis.

storage_requirements.temperature_range: Store at room temperature, avoid excessive heat
storage_requirements.ventilation: Local exhaust ventilation. Store in well-ventilated area away from work areas.
storage_requirements.container_material: Tightly sealed glass or plastic containers. Polyethylene or glass for chromic acid.
storage_requirements.segregation: Separate from combustibles, organics, and reducing agents by 20 feet or firewall. Designated carcinogen storage.
storage_requirements.quantity_limits: Minimize quantities stored. OSHA requires carcinogen storage protocols.
storage_requirements.special_requirements: Post "CANCER HAZARD" and "STRONG OXIDIZER" signs. Restrict access to authorized personnel. Secondary containment for liquids. Inspect weekly for container integrity. Emergency eyewash/shower within 10 seconds.

regulatory_classification.un_number: UN3288 (Toxic solid, inorganic, n.o.s.) or UN1755 (Chromic acid solution)
regulatory_classification.cercla_rq: 5000 pounds (2270 kg) for soluble Cr(VI) compounds

osha_pel.twa_8hr: 5 µg/m³ (as Cr) - applies to all Cr(VI) compounds

biological_exposure_indices.timing: End of shift, end of work week

reactivity.stability: Stable under normal conditions. Some compounds decompose when heated.
reactivity.reactivity_hazard: STRONG OXIDIZER. Reacts violently with combustible materials, reducing agents. Chromates may explode when heated. Corrosive to skin and metals.

environmental_impact.aquatic_toxicity: Very toxic to aquatic life. LC50 (fish, 96h): 10-100 mg/L depending on species. Cr(VI) more toxic than Cr(III).
environmental_impact.biodegradability: Not biodegradable. Cr(VI) can be reduced to less toxic Cr(III) by organic matter and reducing conditions.
environmental_impact.bioaccumulation: Low bioaccumulation potential. Does not concentrate in food chain.
environmental_impact.soil_mobility: High mobility in soil and groundwater as Cr(VI). Adsorbs less than Cr(III). Contaminates wells.
environmental_impact.atmospheric_fate: Settles as particulate. Does not react in atmosphere. Washed out by rain.

detection_monitoring.odor_threshold: Not applicable - no warning odor at hazardous levels
